title: BlackRock Raises $1.7 Billion for New Infrastructure Debt Fund
sub_head: The high-yield fund targets returns in the mid- to high-single digits
body:
BlackRock Inc. has raised $1.67 billion for a new debt fund to finance data centers, toll roads, wind energy and other infrastructure projects around the world, as the asset manager looks to expand its investments in real assets.
BlackRock wrapped up its Global Infrastructure Debt Fund at more than three times its initial goal, the New York firm said. The total amount raised includes $150 million in capital for co-investment deals.
